results.title: Amphibians: frogs, toads and salamanders
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by the creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis as well as their anatomical and physiological characteristics.

results.title: Among the wild chimpanzees
results.creator_credit: Barbara Jampel and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Presents an account of Jane Goodall’s continuing research project with wild chimpanzees in Tanzania. Details her discoveries that chimpanzees not only use but also make tools, they hunt meat and even kill one another. They also suffer from infectious human diseases. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary School students.

results.title: America
results.creator_credit: Hernan Bornas and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Phoebe, Spencer, Felix and Mike have reached a point in their lives where they can no longer call Australia home. Is this due to the recurring statement that Australia is the little brother of America, or the fact that they work at “All American Videos, where too much is never enough”? It is in the videostore, a direct representation of American popular culture, that they devise a plan to rob a bank. They use their favourite films as source material to create the perfect crime.

results.title: Amelia Rose Towers
results.creator_credit: Jackie Farkas, Nicole Sorby and AFTRS
results.brief_description: This multi-award winning Australian short film is distinctly theatrical with its background of rap and parade of surrealist images. The atmosphere is acute and claustrophobic, full of anxiety, fear and loathing. Amelia Rose Towers, whose initials spell ART, faces an adversary who spells MAN, and offers us fragmented glimpses of her own fragile identity.

results.title: Alternative dispute resolution
results.creator_credit: Geoff Russell, Peter Wiseman and Video Classroom
results.brief_description: At some stage in our lives most of us will get caught up in a civil dispute - perhaps involving an employer, a neighbour, our bank, or a complete stranger. Rather than face the daunting, expensive and time-consuming prospect of going to court, in Australia today counselling and mediation are becoming cost-effective alternatives for many smaller civil cases involving a range of disputes. This program - made with the assistance of the Dispute Settlement Centre of Victoria, the Small Claims Tribunal and other relevant civil mediation bodies, uses a dramatised case study (involving a motor vehicle accident) to show how mediation and alternative dispute resolution can help solve a property damage dispute.

results.title: Alpine harvest
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock and Cambridge Film Productions
results.brief_description: A film of the timber industry in the mountainous areas of North-Eastern Victoria. Experts move through the forest, selecting trees to be felled. Then gangs of timber getters move in, felling them, hauling them to the roads, and transporting them to mills.

results.title: Alouette
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren is noted for his many innovative and experimental film animation techniques. He co-animated, with Rene Jodoin, this item for including in a sing-along series, “Lets All Sing Together” (No.1). Single-frame animation of paper cutouts was the technique used.

results.title: Alligators all around
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sendak, Sheldon Riss, Sheriss and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Carole King and Maurice Sendak combine to give a light-hearted alphabet song starring an alligator. An animated family of alligators clowns its way from “Alligators all around” to “Zippity Zound”. From the book “Really Rosie” by Maurice Sendak. Music composed and performed by Carole King. Suitable for lower primary level
